title: Comparative Study on the Effects of Blended Block Instruction Models vs. Traditional Classroom Teaching (K-12)

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Social Science Theory and Experience with Online Learning Platforms
context.additional_context: Offline-centered classroom environment using digital devices (tablets/laptops), with concurrent formative assessments and reflective journaling

learning_goals: Learners can recognize and explain over 80% of the Community of Inquiry (CoI) elements (social, teaching, and cognitive presence) in a blended block instruction model.

Learners will compare the effectiveness of collaborative vs. individual learning across three dimensions (engagement, comprehension, satisfaction), write a structured 500+ character reflection report (introduction-body-conclusion), and achieve 'B' grade or higher in â‰¥4 of 5 rubric criteria.
Learners achieve over 70% goal attainment by leveraging the flexibility of blended learning to plan, execute, and self-direct their studies.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
